info.headline: Dust Advisory issued September 1 at 4:38PM MST until September 1 at 5:30PM MST by NWS Phoenix AZ
info.description:
The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a
* Dust Advisory for... Maricopa County in south central Arizona... Pinal County in southeastern Arizona...
* Until 530 PM MST.
* At 438 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from East Mesa to near Seville to Magma, moving west at 10 mph.
HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 40 mph.
SOURCE...Doppler radar.
IMPACT...Hazardous travel.
* This includes the following highways... US Highway 60 between mile markers 175 and 206. AZ Route 87 between mile markers 136 and 176. AZ Route 202 between mile markers 8 and 12, and between mile markers 24 and 52.
Locations impacted include... Mesa, Chandler, Gilbert, Tempe, Apache Junction, Florence, Coolidge, Gold Canyon, Sun Lakes, East Mesa, Queen Creek, Tempe Marketplace, Falcon Field Airport, Usery Mountain Park, and San Tan Village Mall.
info.instruction:
Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
